Mr Eric Schmidt said that the company's three top executives had decided to "clarify" their roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. The company had always argued in the past that its unusual leadership arrangements worked well, and that it reflected the fact that Google was operated differently from most traditional companies.
